title: Introduction to Lulik and East Timorese Spirituality

questions.question: What is the best translation of the term 'lulik' in East Timorese culture?
choices: Holy
Sacred, forbidden, or taboo
Spiritual
Ancestral
questions.answer: Sacred, forbidden, or taboo

questions.question: What is the primary function of an uma lulik?
choices: A place for community gatherings
A storage facility for agricultural products
A repository for sacred objects and site for rituals
A residence for community leaders
questions.answer: A repository for sacred objects and site for rituals

questions.question: How does lulik influence East Timorese agriculture?
choices: It determines crop rotation schedules
It guides rituals associated with planting and harvesting
It prohibits the use of modern farming techniques
It has no influence on agricultural practices
questions.answer: It guides rituals associated with planting and harvesting

questions.question: What role do ancestors play in East Timorese spirituality?
choices: They are worshipped as gods
They are believed to influence the lives of the living
They are ignored in favor of nature spirits
They are only important during funeral rites
questions.answer: They are believed to influence the lives of the living

questions.question: What is the significance of rai-na'in in East Timorese cosmology?
choices: They are human tribal leaders
They are land spirits or 'owners of the land'
They are sacred animals
They are Catholic saints
questions.answer: They are land spirits or 'owners of the land'

questions.question: How does lulik influence conflict resolution in East Timorese society?
choices: It prohibits all forms of conflict
It requires conflicts to be resolved through physical combat
It plays a role in traditional justice systems and oath-taking ceremonies
It has no influence on conflict resolution
questions.answer: It plays a role in traditional justice systems and oath-taking ceremonies

questions.question: What is Maromak in East Timorese traditional beliefs?
choices: The sacred house
The supreme deity or creator god
The first ancestor
The ritual specialist
questions.answer: The supreme deity or creator god

questions.question: How has the concept of lulik been affected by historical events in East Timor?
choices: It was completely eradicated during colonization
It remained unchanged despite external influences
It persisted as a unifying force and source of cultural resilience
It was replaced by Catholic beliefs during Portuguese rule
questions.answer: It persisted as a unifying force and source of cultural resilience

A traditional woven cloth with spiritual significance

A sacred animal

questions.question: What is a belak in East Timorese culture?

questions.question: What is the significance of whistling at night in some East Timorese communities?
choices: It is encouraged to ward off evil spirits

choices: A type of sacred object
A traditional authority figure and keeper of oral history

A sacred animal

To mark the beginning of the planting season
To end the mourning period
To initiate new community leaders

choices: To celebrate harvest festivals
To set prohibitions protecting natural resources
To initiate young men into adulthood
To communicate with ancestral spirits

questions.question: How does lulik influence social organization in East Timor?

It determines social hierarchies and relationships between clans

Through ancestors and land spirits as intermediaries
